result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua W Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua W Russell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Joshua W Russell was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Regarding Post-Conviction Motion for a New Trial- ORDER: For reasons explained, the Court concludes that trial counsel did not render ineffective assistance to this defn, that the result of this trial is one upon which the Court does not hesitate to rely, and that the post-conviction claim for relief based on alleged ineffective assistance of trial counsel is hereby DENIED. This is a final order of the Court for purposes of appeal. See Decision and Order for details. Copy of Decision and Ordered mailed to Defn and Atty Brehm; copy of order to ADA Hanson via e-filing.

Sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Verdict Counts 1-7  - GUILTY signed, NOT GUILTY not signed.
Question 3 & Answer

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Russell in court with attorney Mario D. White. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. DAY 3 OF 3 
Reporter :  Lynn Schultz - Ctrm w/o jury panel present @8:51 am.  ADA Sattler proposes to file 2nd amended information. Discussion regarding how to amend information regarding facts. Ct recesses so ADA Sattler can make necessary changes to amended 2nd information before filing. ADA Sattler files 2nd amended information.  Atty. White is not requesting special reading of amended information filed today. Ct. accepts second amended information with modified language. ADA Sattler moves to dismiss Cts. 4, 5 & 9 of second amended information.  Ct. grants motion to dismiss Cts. 4, 5 & 9 of second amended information.
Ct. has colloquy with defn about his right to testify or not. Ct. orders defn not to tell the jury how long he has been in custody & custody status. 
Jury present in ctrm 10:08 am
Defense Case
Joshua Russell, defendant, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by Atty. White. Cross by ADA Sattler. Sidebar @ 10:46 am requested by Atty. White.  Redirect by Atty. White.  Defense rests. 
No rebuttal on behalf of the State. 
Jury excused for break at 11:05 am. Ct. recesses @ 11:13 am. Ct. reconvenes @ 11:36 am., on record @ 11:45 am. Jury instruction conference held between Ct. and counsel. Ct. breaks @ 12:21 pm until 12:45pm. 
Reporter: Heather Kieta - Ct. reconvenes outside the presence of the jury panel @1:10 pm. Counsel & Ct. finalizes verdict & jury instruction conference.  Counsel approved final jury instructions & verdict forms.  Jury panel present @ 1:18 pm. 
Final instructions read to jury by Ct. 
Closing argument by ADA Delain @ 1:46 pm -  2:21 pm.  
Closing argument by Atty. White @ 2:23 pm - 2:50 pm.
Rebuttal argument by ADA Sattler @ 2:50 pm  3:10 pm.
Juror 3 - S.A. - chosen as alternate juror & excused @ 3:12 pm. Final instructions read by Ct.  
Bailiff sworn by clerk. Jury removed for deliberations at 3:20 pm. Ct. rules that no exhibits will go to jury.  If they ask we will bring parties together to discuss. 
Reconvened outside presence of jury @ 3:45 pm, Question #1 from jury.  Ct. upon agreement of counsel sent question back to jury.  Juror # 7 expressed concern about continuing with deliberations to bailiff.  Ct & counsel discussed calling alternate that was chosen previously (juror #3) to come back to deliberate. ADA Sattler requests to question Juror #7 to get further details.  Atty. White indicates he does not want any jurors switched out right now. Ct. rules that for now no juror switch will happen.  Recess @ 3:58 pm
Reconvene outside presence of jury @ 5:45 pm, Question #2 from jury regarding exhibits.  Atty. White does not request defendant to be present. No objections to jury seeing all marked photographs, text messages, diagrams, cv of witnesses, and dna report. Ex. 15 (video), ex. 37 floor plan will not go back, ex. 41,42,44,45,46, & 47 will not go back.  Redacted ex. 21 will go back to jury. Ct will retain original & it will be marked ex. 21a from here on out. Recess @ 6:06 pm.
Reconvene @ 8:55 am outside presence of jury, Question #3 from jury.  Neither party objects to the Cts response to the question. Ct notified at same time of jury question that jury had verdict but wanted question #3 answered first.  Jury present in ctrm @ 9:10 pm. Foreperson juror #11
Verdicts read by Ct as follows:  
	Ct 1: GUILTY  
Ct 2: GUILTY
	Ct 3: GUILTY  
	Ct 4: GUILTY - Ct. 4 is Ct. 6 of 2nd amended information 
	Ct 5: GUILTY - Ct. 5 is Ct. 7 of 2nd amended information 
	Ct 6: GUILTY - Ct. 6 is Ct. 8 of 2nd amended information
	Ct 7: GUILTY - Ct. 7 is Ct. 10 of 2nd amended information 
Jury polled by Court on each count. Jury excused by Court @ 9:20 pm. ADA Sattler moves for Judgement on verdicts.   Atty White moves for judgment on verdict not withstanding.  Ct. enters Judgment of Guilty on all 7 counts.  Ct. orders PSI.  Bail revoked.
Question #2 from Jury
Question #1 from Jury and answer.
SECOND

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Russell in court with attorney Mario D. White. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DAY 2 OF 3 - Ctrm outside presence of jury panel @8:38 am.  Jury panel present at 8:48 am.  Ex. 21-22 marked prior to start of trial on day 2.
States case cont.
Jeffrey Gullaume, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA Delain. Cross by Atty. White. Redirect by ADA Delain.
Megan Westphal, nurse, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA Sattler. Ex. 23 marked. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 23 into evidence. No objection by Atty. White.  Ct. receives Ex. 23. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 21 into evidence.  Atty. White ask for sidebar.  Sidebar @ 9:19 am. Ct. receives Ex. 21. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 24-36 into evidence.  No objection by Atty. White.  Ct. receives Ex. 24-36.
Numbering of exhibits 24-36:  Error made by clerk.  No number 35 made. Exhibits are 24-34, no 35 and then 36.
Recess @ 10:40 am.  Reconvened @ 10:44 am. ADA Satter continues with direct exam of Megan Wetphal. Cross by Atty. White. Redirect by ADA Sattler. Recross by Atty White.
Christopher Marzullo, Madison police officer, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA Delain. Cross by Atty. White. Redirect by ADA Delain.  Recross by Atty. White.
Lunch Recess @ 11:39 am. Reconvene @ 12:50pm.  Ctrm  with jury present @ 1:00 pm.  Ex. 37 marked prior to start of testimony for afternoon.
David Martin, duly sworn&testifies.  Direct by ADA Sattler. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 37 into evidence. No objection by Atty. White.  Ct. receives Ex. 37. Cross by Atty White. Atty White moves Ex. 18&19.  No objection by ADA Sattler.  Ct. receives Ex. 18&19. Redirect by ADA Sattler.
William Needelman, Madison police officer, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA Delain.  ADA Sattler asks for sidebar. Sidebar @ 1:35.  Cross by Atty. White. 
Denise Armstrong, Detective Madison Police Department, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA Sattler. Ex. 38-47 marked. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 38-46 into evidence.  No objection by Atty. White. Ex. 38-46 recd. 
Jury recess @ 2:22 pm.  Outside presence of jury  Argument regarding hearsay objection by Atty. White prior to excusing jury.  Ct. adjourns @ 2:34 pm Reconvenes outside presence of jury @ 2:58 pm. Ct overrules objection. Jury panel present in ctrm. @ 3:10 pm.  ADA Sattler continues with direct exam of Denise Armstrong.  Cross by Atty. White. Sidebar @ 3:24 pm after an objection by ADA Sattler. Objection overruled. Redirect by ADA Sattler. 
Kimberly Curran, Forensic Nurse Examiner @ Meriter Hospital, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA Sattler. Ex. 48 marked. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 48 into evidence. No objection by Atty. White.  Ct. receives Ex. 48. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 22 into evidence.  No objection by Atty. White.  Ct. receives Ex. 22. Sidebar @ 3:50 pm after objection from Atty. White. Objection overruled. Sidebar requested by Judge @ 4:08 pm. Cross by Atty. White.
Darrel Monroe, detective Madison Police department, duly sworn & testifies.  Direct by ADA Sattler. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 47 into evidence.  No objection by Atty. White. Ex. 47 recd. Cross by Atty. White. Redirect by ADA Sattler.
Rebecca Siske, state crime lab forensic scientist, duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA Delain. 

Clerk change @ 4:25 pm
Exhibit 50....Crime lab report, moved by State and rec'd.
Cross exam by Atty White. Redirect by State. Witness released from subpoena. 
State rests subject to rebuttal.
Jury released at 4:40 for the day. 
Jury to return at 9:30 am on 5/26
Defense makes motion for acquittal outside of jury presence. Court denies motion.
PRELIMINARY
Curative Instruction to Jury
proposed curative instruction filed by Atty White
AMENDED

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Russell in court with attorney Mario D. White. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. DAY 1 OF 3 - Ctrm w/o final jury panel present.  ADA Sattler and ADA Delain on behalf of the State of WI.  Atty White appears with defendant.  
-State files amended information. Defense does not request special reading &has received a copy. 
-Issue with juror #3.  Ct discusses issue with counsel.  ADA Sattler makes request for juror to be questioned.  Atty White also raises concerns.
-Preliminary jury instructions discussed with counsel. Discussion regarding impeachment of defendant. ADA Sattler argues that number of convictions should be 3.  Atty White makes argument against using any number of convictions. Ct rules that number of convictions will be 2. 
-Exhibits 1-15 marked prior to start of trial on day 1.  
-Juror #3 brought into ctrm to discuss concerns with being able to serve.  ADA Sattler questions juror.  Atty White does not question juror. Ct. excuses juror #3 for cause @ 9:25 am.
-Final jury panel present in Ctrm @ 9:31 am.  Final jury panel sworn by Clerk. Preliminary instructions given by Ct. 
-Opening Stmt by ADA Sattler @ 9:52 am.  10:19am. Atty White requests sidebar at 9:57 am.  Ct. conducts sidebar. Opening stmt by ADA Sattler cont. @ 10:00 am. 
-Opening Stmt by Atty White @ 10:19 am- 10:25 am. 
-Jury excused for break @ 10:26 am. Outside presence of jury ct. further addresses Atty Whites objection during ADA Sattlers opening statement. Argument by ADA Sattler. Argument by Atty White. Atty White requests background of relationship be excluded. Atty White secondly requests that remedy would be a mistrial.  Rebuttal argument by ADA Sattler.  Ct. recesses at 10:45 am.  Ct reconvenes @ 11:25 am outside presence of jury. - Further argument by ADA Sattler and Atty White. Ct. asks Atty White what defendant would request as a remedy. Atty White has discussion w/defendant outside presence of ct. Atty White and defendant back in ctrm at 11:48 am.  Atty White is asking that evidence regarding background of relationship referenced by State in opening be excluded and instruction to jury to exclude.  Atty White withdrawing request for mistrial.  ADA Sattler argues against ct. granting Atty Whites request. Ct. rules that examples of evidence in relationship that go to power and control that were presented by ADA Sattler in opening will not be coming into evidence other than what happened on the day of charged incident. Argument by ADA Sattler of Ct.s ruling. Ct.s ruling stands.  Jury panel present in ctrm. @ 12:16 pm. & excused then for lunch @ 12:18pm.
Reconvened outside presence of jury panel @ 1:20 pm.  Atty White submits proposed curative instruction.  Ct. indicates that proposed instruction is too vague and proposes an alternative instruction to counsel. Atty White accepts cts curative instruction.  ADA Sattler asks for some changes but ct. denies request.  Ct. accepts curative instruction.
Jury panel present in ctrm at 1:32 pm.  Curative instruction given to jury. 
-E.H., duly sworn & testifies. Direct by ADA Sattler. ADA Sattler moves Ex. 1-6 into evidence. No objection by Atty White.  Ex. 1-6 recd. 
Recess @ 3:29 pm. Reconvene @ 3:53 pm. Direct cont. by ADA Sattler. Sidebar @ 4:06 pm after objection by Atty White. ADA Sattler rephrases question that prompted previous objection by Atty White.  ADA Sattler moves Ex. 7-15 into evidence. No objection by Atty White.  Ex. 7-15 recd.  Cross by Atty White moves Ex. 16,17 into evidence  No objection by ADA Sattler. Ex 16,17 recd. Redirect by ADA Sattler. Atty White moves 20 into evidence. No objection by ADA Sattler.  Ex. 20 recd.
-Jury admonished by Ct. & excused for the day @ 6:12 pm. Jury to report at 8:30 am. Ct. adjourned for day at 6:15 pm.
and peremptory challenges

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Mario D. White.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Russell in court with attorney Mario D. White. Prosecuting Atty Rachel E Sattler appeared for State of Wisconsin. -Parties agree to 5 pre-emptory strikes.  ADA Sattler requests 2 alternates due to holiday weekend and length of trial.  
-Ct goes over witness list.  State filed witness list and defense has not nor do they plan to.
-Ct discusses how voir dire will go regarding nature of sexual assault charges and how individual voir dire will go. 
-States motion in limine discussed.
-Defense motion in limine #1  9 granted.
-Defense motion to exclude states expert testimony.  Argument by ADA Sattler. ADA Sattler also indicates that she will not question expert on lethality on strangulation.  Argument by Atty White.  Ct denies motion.  
-Defendant has requested witnesses be excluded from the courtroom.  Ct. orders witness will be excluded from courtroom until after they have testified.  State request  for Detective Monroe to be able to remain in courtroom and be excluded from cts order to have witnesses excluded.  Ct. grants that request. 
- Jurors present at 11:26 am. Introduction by ct. Prospective panel sworn by Clerk.  24 prospective jurors chosen: -Jurors 1-24 seated. 
-Ct. questions panel. Juror #13 excused by Ct. at 11:55.  Juror #25 seated as replacement. Voir dire by ADA Sattler for Plaintiff.  Voir dire by Atty White for Defendant.  
-Recessed for a break at 1:10 pm.  Reconvened at 1:17 pm.  Individual voir dire juror 4,7,12,25,14,17,21,22,24,5,27.  Juror 4 excused for cause @ 1:21 pm.  ADA Satter opposes striking juror 25 for cause& makes argument. Juror 25 excused for cause @ 1:45 pm. Juror 17 excused for cause @ 2:07 pm. Juror 22 excused for cause @2:16 pm. Juror 24 excused for cause @ 2:20 pm. Juror 5 excused for cause @ 2:24 pm. Jurors 26-31 brought into ctrm.  Ct questions jurors 26-31. Juror 27 excused for cause @ 2:43 pm.  Juror 32 called into ctrm. Ct. questions Juror 32. ADA Sattler & Atty White question juror 32.  Juror 12 excused for cause at 2:52 pm.  Juror 33 seated as replacement.  Ct questions juror 33. ADA Sattler and Atty White question juror 33.  Voir dire concludes  jurors not chosen excused at 2:57 pm. 
-Strikes exercised by counsel  5 each.  No Batson objections to peremptory challenges. 14 jurors chosen for panel.  Jurors not chosen excused at 3:09 pm. Ct. admonished jurors.  Impaneling concludes at 3:15 pm.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.  - If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with E.J.H.
- Defendant shall not be on Reetz Rd in  Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not be at Hy-Vee in Fitchburg, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge - Br 5

Ct. sets cash bail at $10,000.  If defendant posts cash bail of $10,000 then he must report to and comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring by 10:00 am the day following his release. If he does not comply with DCBM court will issue a body only warrant.  All other conditions remain the same.
